title: The Digital Personal Data Protection Bill is listed in the Lok Sabha list of business, join IFF's Members and Donors briefing call to dig deeper.
selftext:
​

https://preview.redd.it/enyjmulb9ngb1.png?width=1600&format=png&auto=webp&s=a7106dd5cd0a9417c70785382867f5f95e68fde5

The Digital Personal Data Protection Bill, 2023 is listed in the Lok Sabha List of Business for today to follow how the discussion surrounding this nothing short of contentious bill develops over the day, tune into our live coverage on our telegram channel.

Interested in digging deeper? We will be hosting a Members’ Briefing call this evening at 7PM with Prateek Waghre & Vrinda Bhandari, moderated by Tejasi Panjiar.

 If you’re a member, the invite is in your inbox, for everyone else, get your membership – we’ll do the rest! [https://internetfreedom.in/donate](https://internetfreedom.in/donate)  


For a quick primer ahead of the call, check out:  
1. IFF’s [statement](https://internetfreedom.in/statement-dpdpb-2023/) on the DPDPB, 2023 

2. IFF’s [First Read](https://internetfreedom.in/iffs-first-read-of-the-draft-digital-personal-data-protection-bill-2023/) on the DPDPB, 2023, which highlights key issues and compares this draft with its predecessor 

3. An [op-ed](https://twitter.com/internetfreedom/status/1687707230412431360?s=20) by IFF’s Founder Director, Apar Gupta in *The Hindustan Times,* which makes a simple case— poor process will result in poor outcome 

4. An [explainer](https://twitter.com/internetfreedom/status/1688061731816271872?s=20) by IFF staffers, Radhika Roy and Tejasi Panjiar in *The Hindu* answering all your questions about the DPDPB, 2023 

5. An [op-ed](https://twitter.com/internetfreedom/status/1688431796398993409?s=20) by IFF’s Policy Director, Prateek Waghre in *The Economic Times* that asks: how much data does the Digital Personal Data Protection Bill, 2023 really protect?
